title: Big Thicket National Preserve: History & Culture
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture             History & Culture         NPS Photo  The Big Thicket In 1936 the regional study, "Biological Survey of the East Texas Big Thicket Area," was completed by H.B. Parks and V.L. Cory. This report played a significant role in the future protection of the Big Thicket. It was the first effort by concerned people to document and begin a protection scheme of this unique landscape. At the time of the report, it was stated that the Big Thicket area was over one million acres in size. more...
